docs.snippet: The Jets’ new general manager will have the autonomy to improve certain areas, like the quarterback mess and eroded talent, but will not be able to change coaches, not at first....
docs.lead_paragraph: The Jets’ new general manager will have the autonomy to improve certain areas, like the quarterback mess and eroded talent, but will not be able to change coaches, not at first.
docs.abstract: New York Jets begin interviewing candidates to replace general manager Mike Tannenbaum; next general manager will have autonomy to improve certain areas, like the quarterback mess and eroded talent, but will not be able to replace coach Rex Ryan, at least initially.

headline.seo: New General Manager Will Inherit Jets’ Chaos, Plus Rex Ryan
headline.main: New G.M. Will Inherit Jets’ Chaos, Plus Coach
headline.print_headline: New G.M. Will Inherit Jets’ Chaos, Plus Coach

docs.snippet: A cooperative subject in Nick Saban, plenty of input from his wife and the right designer went into the making of a nine-foot statue of Alabama’s football coach....
docs.lead_paragraph: A cooperative subject in Nick Saban, plenty of input from his wife and the right designer went into the making of a nine-foot statue of Alabama’s football coach.
docs.abstract: Statue honoring Alabama head football coach Nick Saban, which was unveiled in April 2011, relied on timing and teamwork; designer Jeremy Davis spent some 250 hours producing a three-foot mold, with constant consultation from Saban's wife Terry.

headline.seo: Statue Honoring Alabama’s Nick Saban Relied on Timing and Teamwork
headline.main: Teamwork Continues in Honoring a Coach
headline.print_headline: Teamwork Continues In Honoring a Coach

docs.abstract: Two days before the B.C.S. title game, Alabama Coach Nick Saban had a chance to talk about one of his favorite things: his process.

docs.lead_paragraph: Alabama’s defensive coordinator, Kirby Smart, attracts interest from other programs but says his job of coaching with Nick Saban is tough to beat.
docs.abstract: Alabama defensive coordinator Kirby Smart is attracting interest elsewhere, but says his job of coaching with Nick Saban is tough to beat.

headline.seo: Alabama’s Kirby Smart in No Rush to Leave Nick Saban’s Shadow
headline.main: In No Rush to Leave Saban’s Shadow

docs.snippet: New York City has bought millions of “super stacker” classroom chairs since the 1990s, but districts around the country are choosing models deemed ergonomically superior....
docs.lead_paragraph: New York City has bought millions of “super stacker” classroom chairs since the 1990s, but districts around the country are choosing models deemed ergonomically superior.
docs.abstract: New York City public schools have continued to buy millions of familiar, durable 'super stacker' chairs, even as other districts around the country have turned to ergonomic alternatives; cost of conversion could be extremely high, though schools chancellor Dennis M Walcott remains open to change.

headline.seo: Some Schools Buy New Chairs, in a Break With the Past
headline.main: Ergonomic Seats? Most Pupils Squirm in a Classroom Classic
headline.print_headline: Ergonomic Seats? Most Pupils Squirm in a Classroom Classic

byline.contributor: Alain Delaquérière and Sheelagh McNeill contributed research.

docs.snippet: A break for speed racing, like similar special benefits, will cost the government millions, but supporters defended it as a tax break....
docs.lead_paragraph: A break for speed racing, like similar special benefits, will cost the government millions, but supporters defended it as a tax break.
docs.abstract: Owners of auto racetracks, with help of devoted Nascar fans in Congress and lobbyists, secure one-year extension of expiring tax break that allows them to write off investments in their property over 7 years, rather than 15 years; this break for speed racing, along with other similar special benefits granted in new tax deal, will cost government millions over next decade.

headline.seo: Owners of Auto Racetracks Retain a Tax Break
headline.main: Auto Racetrack Owners Keep Coveted Tax Break
headline.print_headline: Auto Racetrack Owners Keep Coveted Tax Break
